HELP_CONTENT1_0_TITLE: How to configure your username and password from ISP
HELP_CONTENT1_0: Click on the icon ADSL and a new window will open. In the field 'User' type the user name provided by your ISP (eg nome@provedor.com.br) and password.
HELP_CONTENT1_1: Some people define Internet as the 'Network of Networks' and others as 'The Information Highway'. Indeed, Internet is a network of networks because it is made from joining many local computer networks, or a few computers in a household, building or company. This global network has the feature that uses a common language that ensures the intercommunication between different participants. This common language or protocol is known as TCP/IP.
HELP_CONTENT1_2: Every computer that takes part in Internet is called 'host'. Some 'host' serve content, information or applications so they are called servers. And other computers, like you are using, consuming the content or the information provided by the servers. This relationship called client-server is the basis of Internet functioning: some computers provide information that is consumed and used by others.
HELP_CONTENT1_3_TITLE: What is the web, www or World Wide Web?
HELP_CONTENT1_3: It is important to know that web or www are not synonymous of Internet, web ia subset of Internet that consists of pages that can be accesssed using a browser. Internet is the network of networks where all information resides. Email, messaging programs, games,etc. are part of Internet, but not of Web.
HELP_CONTENT1_4: A protocol is the established language that computers use on having communicate and exchange information. We, as human beings, use the language as protocol, in this case we have agreed to communicate with English language.
HELP_CONTENT1_5_TITLE: What does IP stand for? What is an IP address?
HELP_CONTENT1_5: IP address acts as the registry or the ID of each computer on Internet or internal network in your home. Must be unique in each network and consists of four numbers separated by a dot. For example, 192.168.1.1 is the IP address of HomeStation within the network from home.
HELP_CONTENT1_6_TITLE: How can I connect to the Internet?
HELP_CONTENT1_6: Over the years, the technology for Internet access has changed to adapt to the needs of people and resources. The main reason for changing the types of Internet access has been the connection speed. Currently need a very good speed if you want to take all the best Internet resources (animations, television online, 3D, video, etc). This is what is known as broadband, being DSL technology the most common connection for homes and small businesses and 3G technology the favorite for mobile devices (like mobile phones or laptops).
HELP_CONTENT1_7_TITLE: Why do I need HomeStation to browse the Internet?
HELP_CONTENT1_7: The key to Internet is the ability to connect and send information between different networks. Thus, information can reach computers that are not on your local network. What is needed is that our network have a device (HomeStation or conventional router) responsible of being the intermediary and connect to other networks on the Internet.
HELP_CONTENT1_8_TITLE: Is there also a network in my Home?
HELP_CONTENT1_8: Inside your home there is also a computer network like Internet but internal and much smaller. This enables you to browse your local network (known as 'Home Network') and communicate between devices (such as computers or printers) that have connected through your HomeStation, for example, to share files between them.
HELP_CONTENT1_9_TITLE: What is a web browser? What is it used for?
HELP_CONTENT1_9: A web browser is a program or software, usually free, that allow us to display web pages in Internet. The most popular browsers are Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Safari and Google Chrome.
HELP_CONTENT1_10_TITLE: What is a web page? Is it the same as a web site?
HELP_CONTENT1_10: If you compare it with a book, a website would be a whole book and a web page of this website would be a chapter of that book. A website is a site (location) on Internet that contains documents (web pages) organized. Each document (web page) contains graphics, text, audio, video, and other dynamic or static materials that appear as digital information on a computer screen.
HELP_CONTENT1_11: HTML is the acronym for HyperText Markup Language and is the language used to create web pages. This language tells the browser how to display the contents of a web page.
HELP_CONTENT1_12_TITLE: Why some web pages are slower than others?
HELP_CONTENT1_12: Although with broadband this is no longer a problem, web pages are composed of graphics, text, audio, video, ... the number and complexity of these influences the time it takes to download a web page. Access to a page with just text is not the same that access to a page that includes many images and videos that are heavier and therefore may take longer to be downloaded by your browser.
HELP_CONTENT1_13_TITLE: What is the meaning of 'download from Internet'?
HELP_CONTENT1_13: Download is to copy data (usually an entire file) from any Internet source to a device in your home, such as your computer. The opposite of download is upload, which means copy a file from your computer to another computer that is in Internet.
HELP_CONTENT1_14: A link is text or images on a website that a user can 'click' to access or connect to another document. The links are as the technology that connects two websites or two web pages. When you navigate Internet, these links are usually seen as underlined words.
HELP_CONTENT2_1: Bandwidth is the amount of information or data that can be sent and received through your Internet connection to bits per second (bit/s or bps), kilobits per second (Kbit/s or Kbps) or megabits per second (Mb/s or Mbps). In general, a connection with high bandwidth is known as 'broadband' and is one that can carry enough information to play smoothly a video (no cuts or breaks).
HELP_CONTENT2_2_TITLE: What is a bit? What is mega? And giga?
HELP_CONTENT2_2: A bit is the smallest unit of information used in computing. With it, we can represent two values whichever, true or false, open or closed, white or black... Just assign these values to 'off'(0) status, and the other to 'on'(1) status. To represent or encode more information we need to group them into a larger number of bits. So 1 kilobit is a thousand bits, 1 megabit is one million bits and 1 is a thousand megabits. The most common connection broadband speeds are usually between 1 and 6 Mbps, for example, with a speed of 1 Mbps can take about a minute to download a song from the Internet.
HELP_CONTENT2_3: ADSL means Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line and is the technology used to connect to broadband Internet.
HELP_CONTENT2_4:
3G it is the abbreviation for third generation of mobile telephony. It is a technology initially used in mobile phones to send and receive calls, but that being a broadband connection is also used in the present to connect to Internet through a mobile phone or a laptop.
The HomeStation may use an USB 3G modem connected to its USB port and configured by clicking on the 3G icon of the advanced interface. Such connection will act as a backup for the ADSL Access. Currently, the following models are supported by the HomeStation:

HELP_CONTENT2_8: PIN code (Personal Identification Key) is a four digit password used to access mobiles, ATMs, telephone services, etc. For HomeStation, this key is associated with the SIM card.

HELP_CONTENT3_1: A password is a secret series of characters (usually letters and numbers) that allows a user to access a computer or a program. Passwords help ensure that unauthorized users do not have access to what is protected. Ideally, the password should be something that nobody can guess.
HELP_CONTENT3_2_TITLE: Does HomeStation need a password? Why?
HELP_CONTENT3_2: Yes, HomeStation has a setup password. It allows you to make changes to the HomeStation settings and also makes sure that only you can make those changes. You can access your HomeStation web page without using password and view the status of your network, but when you try to access secure features, we ask you the password. Once you enter HomeStation password, you can further configure your network and not bother you again.
HELP_CONTENT3_3_TITLE: How to modify the configuration password?
HELP_CONTENT3_3: You can change to a different, and we recommend that you do. To do this click on the link 'Change Password' on the top right of the Network Map. As this is a delicate operation, if you have not entered your password, you will be prompted to enter. Finally, you receive the password change form. In the first field will have to enter your current password and then the new password twice, to make sure you do not write a bad character. Strength indicator will tell you if your new password is good or if it is easy to guess.
HELP_CONTENT3_4_TITLE: I forgot the configuration password, what can I do?
HELP_CONTENT3_4:
You can restore the original password by pressing the back button HomeStation (reset) for 10 seconds.
Your password will be the same as that in the lower bumper.
Note that HomeStation will restart with factory settings. Your internet connection will still work, but you will lose all your personal settings.
HELP_CONTENT3_5_TITLE: What is the risk of connecting to the internet?
HELP_CONTENT3_5: By the simple act of connecting to Internet is absolutely no danger. Another thing very different are the potential threats that can occur by a foolish and unwise use of some Internet services (for example, execute files unreliable). Note that there are websites that are totally reliable. In general, all of which are of a known brand, personal sites, portals, search engines, shopping ... The golden rule for safe navigation could be summarized as: If someone asks you to install something and not know what is going on or at a particular time antivirus informs you of a possible threat ... YOU SHOULD NOT INSTALL ANYTHING YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND and exit the web page immediately, closing the browser if necessary.
HELP_CONTENT3_6_TITLE: How to avoid Internet fraud and protect my personal information?
HELP_CONTENT3_6: It is increasingly important to protect our personal and confidential information like passwords, credit card numbers and bank account information. The following list shows some things you can do to protect your private data on Internet: Before providing your information, research if the company exists. A website is not a proof that the company exists. Make sure the site is secure, the URL starts with 'https' instead of just 'http'. When you use your credit card on a new website, check your bank account in the following days to ensure that no have been making unauthorized purchases. Do not use the same password for all accounts. If an account is compromised, all accounts are compromised. Keep your antivirus updated. Do not open attachments in emails from someone you do not know. Never answer any email that asks you for your banking information. Print receipts for your transactions.
HELP_CONTENT3_7_TITLE: Can I get a virus on my computer by browsing the Internet?
HELP_CONTENT3_7: Yeah, but you do not panic. The most common is via email or download a file from a website of dubious origin. And in general when there is an exchange of files. But it can be avoided if you follow a few simple rules and using common sense: Every time we meet with an email that contains a file should take care not to open it without first passing a good antivirus, and if it is dubious delete. In the case of the files that we downloaded from a web page we should follow the following rule: If someone asks you to install something and not know what is going on or at any given time the virus jumps reports of a possible threat... YOU SHOULD NOT INSTALL ANYTHING YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND.
HELP_CONTENT3_8: A computer virus is software that is self-executing and spreads by inserting copies of itself to another program or document. Like human viruses, computer viruses can spread in many ways: some viruses cause only mildly annoying effects while others can damage your hardware, software or files. Almost all viruses are attached to an executable file, which means that the virus can be in your computer but can not infect you unless you run or open the infected program. It is important to note that a virus can not continue their spread without human action (eg running an infected program). People contribute to the spread of the virus, often unknowingly, by sharing infected files or sending e-mails with viruses as attachments.
HELP_CONTENT3_9_TITLE: What is NOT a computer virus?
HELP_CONTENT3_9: We often think that our problems are due to computer virus. The following issues are not usually caused by viruses: Hardware problems. There are no viruses that can physically damage hardware. The computer produces a beep when starting up and the screen does not display anything. Most often this is due to a hardware problem during the boot process. You can not open a file. If you have trouble opening other files, may be that you can not open file is damaged.
HELP_CONTENT3_10_TITLE: What software is recommendable to browse the Internet with security?
HELP_CONTENT3_10: In general, it is highly recommended to have always installed and updated an antivirus and an antispyware program. If you want additional protection you can install a firewall and, if you have small children at home, you may find useful parental control program.
HELP_CONTENT3_11_TITLE: What is a antivirus? What is it used for?
HELP_CONTENT3_11: It is a software which aims to prevent and avoid virus infection, also preventing their spread. There is capacity to detect and remove viruses and restore the files affected by the infection.
HELP_CONTENT3_12_TITLE: What is a antispyware software? What is it used for?
HELP_CONTENT3_12: Spyware is any software application that collects information from the computer from which it is operating. Usually it enters and operates on computers without the user noticing. Therefore an antispyware program is a software to remove spyware.
HELP_CONTENT3_13_TITLE: What is a firewall? What is it used for?
HELP_CONTENT3_13: A firewall is software that prevents unauthorized use and access to your computer, and Internet attacks. A firewall examines what comes from the Internet, and depending on their nature allows him to continue or, conversely, blocks it. That is, the safe enters and the harmful (an attack) is rejected. If it is installed, all incoming and outgoin messages from your home network pass through the firewall, which examines each message and blocks those that do not fit specified security criteria. Is important to remember that a firewall does not remove the computer virus problem, but when used in conjunction with regular updates that your Windows system offers (or another operating system) and a good antivirus, added safety and extra protection to your computer and network.
HELP_CONTENT3_14_TITLE: How to block inappropriate Internet content for my children?
HELP_CONTENT3_15_TITLE: How to stop strangers from using your Home network?
HELP_CONTENT4_1: The network map is a graphical representation of all computers and devices (eg printers, cell phones, game consoles,...) that are in your home network. Displays which devices are connected and which are no connected (with a lighter gray color). Also indicates whether they are connected by wire or wireless network (WiFi).
HELP_CONTENT4_2_TITLE: How to connect my devices (computers, cell phones,â€? to Internet through HomeStation?
HELP_CONTENT4_2:
The easiest is to connect to WiFi network, which creates HomeStation. If the device will be in a fixed location near you HomeStation, you can also connect to the RJ45 cable.
If you decide to use the wireless network, enter the configuration menu by clicking on the HomeStation icon within the Network Map. Look at these settings of the WiFi because then you'll need them to connect your devices.
You must connect each of your devices as instructed by your operating system. In general, you should enter the wireless settings of the device, seek HomStation WiFi and connect to it. If the system asks a security protocol, select one according to the level of security you set up in HomeStation. The acronym in parentheses give you a clue.
When the system asks you the key to WiFi, set the same you have configured the WiFi in your HomeStation.
So you have devices connected to your home network. For Internet access we recommend that you enable DHCP on your HomeStation and configure your devices for use.
HELP_CONTENT4_3_TITLE: What is the HomeStation USB port used for?
HELP_CONTENT4_3: USB are the initials of Universal Serial Bus. In computers, an USB is a system that transfers data or electricity between components of your computer or between computers. HomeStation can communicate with printers (to share a single printer to all computers of your home network) and with hard disks or USB keys (to access your files from any computer on your home network) and for carrying out this communication uses the USB input.
HELP_CONTENT4_4_TITLE: HomeStation has only a USB port, how to conenct a hard disk and a printer simultaneously?
HELP_CONTENT4_4: If you need to connect at the same time, we recommend you buy a USB Hub Expander. These are very cheap and you can easily have 4 USB devices connected to HomeStation.
HELP_CONTENT4_5_TITLE: What is the difference between a computer connected with a wire or thorough a wireless connection (WiFi)?
HELP_CONTENT4_5:
The cable connection is more secure because it requires a direct physical access to your HomeStation. You'll never be intruders in your network if you disable the WiFi and only use wired connections.
However, it will be much easier for you to connect your computers to the wireless network and will remain safe if properly configured.
The cable connection is faster, but if you're going to use your computer to connect to Internet normally you will not notice difference between your computers connect via cable or WiFi.
HELP_CONTENT4_6:
In such networks, communications between devices are made via the 'air'. Cable is not required to carry the 'messages' from one device to another, because these messages are transformed into electromagnetic signals travel through the air as it does visible light. Do not worry, these signs are safe, in fact, we see the light is also electromagnetic radiation, emitted in a certain range of frequencies, that our eyes can grasp.
In the case of WiFi, the electromagnetic signals emitted in the 2.4 gigahertz band.
Your HomeStation acts as an access point or coordinator of the wireless network and allows or denies access to the network devices.
HELP_CONTENT4_7_TITLE: How to improve the wireless connection (WiFi) signal?
HELP_CONTENT4_8_TITLE: How to configure my wireless connection (WiFi)?
HELP_CONTENT4_8:
You will find the WiFi configuration menu by clicking on HomeStation icon within the Network Map. This menu contains a section dedicated to the WiFi settings where you can configure everything related to the wireless network in your HomeStation.
You can enable and disable your wireless network.
You can view and change the name of the WiFi network.
You can make the network visible to the devices and networks displayed when searching or hide, to avoid exposing your network to intruders.
You can set the security level and password for your WiFi.
And finally you can configure the channel selection mode used by your network.
HELP_CONTENT4_9_TITLE: How to change my wireless connection (WiFi) name? Why to change it?
HELP_CONTENT4_9:
Just enter the HomeStation settings menu, clicking on the HomeStation icon in the Network Map. In the wireless section, you can see and change the name of your WiFi.
Depending on location, it is quite possible that there are many networks in the environment. Put a name that means something to you will help you find your network when looking to connect your devices.
If you decide to change the name when you have your network running, keep in mind that you'll need to configure your wireless devices, again.
HELP_CONTENT4_10_TITLE: What is the wireless connection (WiFi) security level?
HELP_CONTENT4_10:
In wireless networks your data and communications are transmitted by the 'air', a mechanism is needed to prevent intruders, who could listen to your communications, use your network, change your contact information, etc ...
For this there are mechanisms and protocols, to encrypt and to secure wireless communications. Do not use them, is completely insecure.
If you use them, you know that there are some that are outdated and have no barrier to intruders (WEP Protocol, low security). This protocol is still used to connect to WiFi, ancient devices, but we do not recommend its use.
If you want your network is secure, use a high security level. This means that your wireless communications are protected by WPA and WPA2 protocols, currently considered safe.
HELP_CONTENT4_11_TITLE: What is the wireless connection (WiFi) key strength?
HELP_CONTENT4_11: The strength of your key indicates how difficult it is guessed by an intruder seeking to connect to your network without your permission.
HELP_CONTENT4_12_TITLE: What is the wireless connection (WiFi) channel? Why to switch to manual mode?
HELP_CONTENT4_12:
The WiFi network can use different frequency bands, usually numbered from 1 to 13. If your network and your neighbors are using the same frequency channel may be interference between both networks and the quality of both lower or even unusable.
In manual mode, you can force your HomeStation to use specific channels to try to avoid these problems.
HELP_CONTENT4_13_TITLE: What is DHCP? What is it used for?
HELP_CONTENT4_13: A protocol of your HomeStation that automatically assigns IP addresses and other network parameters to your devices when it connect to your home network.
HELP_CONTENT4_14_TITLE: How to configure my computer IP address manually?
HELP_CONTENT5_1_TITLE: What kind of devices can I connect to the Internet with HomeStation?
HELP_CONTENT5_1: You can connect any IP device that has network connectors RJ45 (the typical network cable connector, a little larger than the telephone cable connector), or WiFi support (in this case check the manual device that supports one of the following protocols: 802.11b or 802.11g).
HELP_CONTENT5_2_TITLE: My old devices can not connect. What is happening?
HELP_CONTENT5_2: If connected via WiFi, being old may not be ready to communicate using the security protocol you have selected. Check the security level and the device manufacturer's manual. If the device does not support WPA, you must select a low security level (WEP) or 'No Security' in your HomeStation, to connect your device. However, the security level of all devices on your network will go down so we do not recommend.
HELP_CONTENT5_3_TITLE: There is a new and unknow device with some numbers (192.168â€? as the name. How to identify it?
HELP_CONTENT5_3:
Have you recently had a visit at home? It is possible that in the case of a laptop or mobile phone that has been in your home. If not, first you must look out for the symbol that accompanies the device icon in the upper right. Tells you if the device is connected via wired network, WiFi or USB. That should help you identify which device.
Check if connected or disconnected, it could also give you a clue. You can try to connect and disconnect devices until the unidentified equipment status change in the Network Map.
Once you have located the computer, we recommend that you personalize, giving it a name and assigning it a type of device, so that in the future you are clear on which device it is.
If a computer is not coming back online, it is best to go into your settings and you click the 'remove device'. So he'll never bother.
HELP_CONTENT5_4_TITLE: How to remove a device that I am not using anmore from the network map?
HELP_CONTENT5_4: About Network Map, click to open the device configuration. Click on 'Forget device' and no longer appear in your network map. Unless, of course, that is reconnected. If you do not find the link 'Forget your device ', may be that the device is still connected. In that case, disconnect and try again.
HELP_CONTENT5_5:
In the Network Map, you can see the HomeStation icon and right a bag in which there are devices on your network. These are devices that are or have been connected to your home network, either cable, WiFi or USB. Some may no longer be connected and appear more blurred.
Connected or not, you can configure by clicking its icon. This opens a dialog where you can do the following:
-Give a name to your computer
-Assign a type of device to display an image represented by more appropriate.
-View your IP address and status.
-Forget the device.
-Open ports for this device
If you need more advanced configuration of applications and ports, you can click 'Configure applications and ports'.
HELP_CONTENT5_6:
This is a device that has not been set, in other words, a device to which you have not yet assigned name or type of device. As will appear with a generic icon that gives no information on what type of device and may appear with an IP address instead of name.
Normally this will be a new device on your network connect just recently. Even if you have activated a high level of security on your WiFi, also, the device may be a neighbor that has crept into your network. In that case, forget the device will not prevent reconnect, and will need to upload the security level of your WiFi.
HELP_CONTENT5_7_TITLE: Did you know yo can share your files between devices connected to your Home network (both between them and accessing the USB disk connected to HomeStation)?
HELP_CONTENT5_7:
That's right. If you connect to your HomeStation a USB storage device with your files, you can access them from any of your computers in the home. Click on your HomeStation, there will appear in your network map as one more device.
If you connect your USB printer to HomeStation, you can use it to print from any of your computers in the home. Click on your HomeStation and will also appear in your network map.
HELP_CONTENT5_8: To access your files from a computer running Windows OS, go to this page from your computer, locate the storage device icon in the Network Map, click on it and download the installation file on your computer. Run it from there and follow their instructions.
HELP_CONTENT5_8_TITLE: How I access from my computer to the contents of my flash drive or my USB hard drive connected to HomeStation?
HELP_CONTENT5_9: To access the printer from a Windows OS computer, go to this page from your computer, locate the printer icon in the Network Map, click on it and download the installation file on your computer. Run it from there and follow their instructions. If you have any problems with the process, it is recommended that you install the printer driver following the instructions fabricate and try again.
HELP_CONTENT5_9_TITLE: How do I install on my computer, the USB printer connected to HomeStation?
HELP_CONTENT6_1:
The ports are used for applications on a computer, communicate with each other or with other applications on other computers.
In a computer, there are many applications running simultaneously and communicating with other applications on other computers over the Internet. These communications are made by sending messages. Imagine that I am chatting with you, my messaging application send a message to your computer with the text I'm writing.
This message will have the IP address of your computer as the destination address, and the network know to get the message to your computer. But once your computer has received the message. How do you know what to do with it? Received a message from the network. What application is it? Why the mailer? Why web browser? Why On-Line game is also booted?
To resolve this, use the ports. It is like addresses or PO boxes within a team. An application is listening on a specific port (or more), and so other applications can send messages to that particular computer to that port. The operating system receives the message from the network and passes it to the application that is listening on that port.
HELP_CONTENT6_2_TITLE: What is to open a port?
HELP_CONTENT6_2:
Is to configure your HomeStation to allow external systems to your network, found on internet, can initiate a communication with a computer in your home network. This in principle is not allowed for security reasons, and you have to open ports to allow such communications to an application you can trust.
If you understood well what are the ports, go a little further ... Your devices have ports to communicate, Your HomeStation also has its own ports to receive messages from the Internet. When they get messages that have not been ordered by a computer in your network, Your HomeStation not do anything with them, ignore them. So in principle your network is safe and nothing from outside can connect with computers on your network, if you do not initiate communication. However, some applications that use much the network would work better if the communication could begin on both counts (messaging programs, P2P, games, etc ...). Such applications often ask you to open ports to operate.
What is open the ports? Is it that you configure your HomeStation for messages received are directed to a particular port, and skip the redirect a particular port of one of the computers in your network. For example, if your console uses port 3655, you could redirect your HomeStation port 3655 to port 3655 of your console.
HELP_CONTENT6_3_TITLE: Why I need to open a port?
HELP_CONTENT6_3:
Some applications that use the network much, these need to run or go faster. Usually messaging programs, P2P applications, games, etc ...
The ports that use the application will be redirected from HomeStation to your computer, so other Internet computers can connect to your application.
HELP_CONTENT6_4_TITLE: How to open a port to an application and assign to a device?
HELP_CONTENT6_4:
You have several ways:
The easiest way is to go into the device settings in the Network Map and the 'open ports for this device' enables the application you want to open ports on that device. Then click 'Accept' and HomeStation appropriate ports opened for the device.
If the application you want is not listed or is already assigned to another device (the check is deactivated and the device icon to the right of the application), you must create a new application in 'Configuring applications and portsâ€? Click and used the advanced settings of ports to create a new application to open the ports needed for your device.
HELP_CONTENT6_5_TITLE: Is it possible to have multiple computers with the same application port open in all of them?
HELP_CONTENT6_5:
Use of this section is easier than it looks.
On the left is the list of applications that are already set. Remember that this application is a set of rules that open ports. We do not mean the application itself, but the set of rules (open ports) needed for that application to function properly.
Returning to the list, you'll see on your right, some have a device icon and not others. Icon indicates that the application is associated with a device. HomeStation has open ports for the application for that device. Not be associated with another device without canceling the current partnership. Other applications (those with no icon) are applications that are not associated with any device. You can use them and will open the appropriate ports for the device you want.
To modify an application from the list, click on it and the configuration of the application will be released in the right pane, from which you can change their name, their rules for opening ports and assign it to a device.
If you need to create a new application (it does not yet exist or is not available), click on the '+' button below the list of applications. In the right pane configuration appears (empty) for your new application. Give it a name, add the rules for opening ports you need and assign it to a device.
If you want to delete an application select it in the application list and click on the '-' button underneath the list.
To change the name of an application in the edit panel applications click on the pencil icon next to its current name and you can give a different name.
To add a rule to an application when the application is selected you click on '+ Add Rule', and a new empty rule is added to the list of rules. Modify it.
To modify a rule, plays with fields that are, are quite intuitive. With the first button you can determine whether to open a single port or a range of several consecutive ports. Depending on the case, indicates the port number or first and last ports in the range. Finally you must indicate whether the ports should be opened only for TCP traffic, UDP traffic only or for both.
To delete a rule, click the button '-' at the end of the applicable rule.
To associate the application to a device, stand in the drop down list 'for device' and select the device you want to open ports.
When you've finished editing your application, click 'Save Changes' before closing the dialog or switch applications. The changes you make will be saved and will open the corresponding ports.
HELP_CONTENT6_6:
Yes and no.
In principle, the redirection mechanism (opening) of ports does not let you do this. A port can only be opened or forwarded to a single device. And so each application can only be assigned to a team.
However, can one or more similar applications, using other port numbers. In this case, from computers or other equipment, you must configure the application to use the ports that you assigned in HomeStation. Learn how to do this in the manual for the particular application.
HELP_CONTENT6_6_TITLE: Can I have multiple computers configured with the ports of an open application?
HELP_CONTENT7_1: It is popularly said that 'hardware is what you hit when software fails'. The reality is that 'hardware' are all the physical and tangible components that make up a computer (such as CPU or hard disk) while 'software' is the logical equipment and intangible as programs and data stored on your computer.
HELP_CONTENT7_2_TITLE: What is electronic mail or e-mail?
HELP_CONTENT7_2: Electronic mail or e-mail, is a method for creating, sending and receiving messages over Internet.
HELP_CONTENT7_3_TITLE: What is spam? How to avoid it?
HELP_CONTENT7_3: Spam is sending unsolicited e-mails (usually commercial) and in bulk quantities. These messages are known as spam. Many of these messages are distinguishable at a glance by reading the header because they include the dollar sign, the word 'free' or some exotic job offer. Mail programs often include message filtering systems that may be useful to prevent spam. In general, it is enough to use common sense to deal with spam, and not sufficient to give our email address only to friends and never reply to a spam message, although in many cases the direction of sender is false, if not serve the advertising company to know that our e-mail address is correct and continue to send unwanted advertising.
HELP_CONTENT7_4: Chat describes the conversation in real time (instantaneously) between two or more people through Internet. Typically in a chat session is that a user type messages using the keypad and the message is displayed on the screen of another user (or others), but the conversation can also be done with audio and video.
HELP_CONTENT7_5_TITLE: How to improve my computer performance?
HELP_CONTENT7_5: Over time, computers tend to collect unnecessary information and the computer begins slower and its operation begins to deteriorate. You can do some simple things  to keep your computer running correctly: Uninstall software and programs that do not use. Delete Temporary Internet files. Use the minimum possible number of toolbars in your browser. Use the browser that use the minimum possible resources, especially if your computer is old. Scans your computer with an antivirus once a week. Scans your computer with a spyware program once a week. Be sure to update your antivirus and antispyware regularly. Accept the automatic updates of Windows (or another operating system).
